paper_abstract: We present explicit constructions of centrally symmetric -neighborly -dimensional polytopes with about vertices and of centrally symmetric -neighborly -polytopes with about vertices. Using this result, we construct for a fixed and arbitrarily large and , a centrally symmetric -polytope with vertices that has at least faces of dimension , where and for . Another application is a construction of a set of points in every two of which are strictly antipodal as well as a construction of an -point set (for an arbitrarily large ) in with many pairs of strictly antipodal points. The two latter results significantly improve the previous bounds by Talata, and Makai and Martini, respectively.
paper_title: Explicit Constructions of Centrally Symmetric k-Neighborly Polytopes and Large Strictly Antipodal Sets
